intro: Clermontia clermontioides, commonly known as the Hawaiian spiderling, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and trailing growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, Clermontia clermontioides is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
